channel.title: Blast Pit improvement suggestion...
channel.description:
And it's simply this: Make the [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8jnFgqS5ZgM']"Blast Pit 3"[/url] soundtrack sync up better with firing the rocket engine to burn the tentacle, which is how I imagined it would be when I first heard it before the mod was released.
It's currently set to play as you enter the silo a third time, which can be hit and miss if it was meant to sync with the rocket engine depending on the player. [url='https://youtu.be/A3t-Z8uCysA']Here's a naff video I made to demonstrate how it would be compared to how it is.[/url] Also the burning animation may have to be slowed by half, which I emulated in the vid (tentacle roar sounds optional). It's a minor mod that may improve this bit of the game a fair bit IMO. Maybe the BMS dev team can do something similar to how they synced the music at the end Surface Tension when being chased by the Gargantua?

item.title: Blast Pit improvement suggestion...
item.dc:creator: Malidictus
item.description:
I’m a big fan of syncing music to on-screen actions. I’d actually suggest keying it off pressing the button and simply delaying the engine ignition longer. I mean, it’s a rocket engine ignition. Even if it’s automated, you’d think it’d take a while, and having the guitar tune would keep it from getting boring.

But the video was awesome. I wish it were timed this well for me.

item.title: Blast Pit improvement suggestion...
item.dc:creator: TCMOREIRA
item.description:
Bloodshot:

I still feel like the song itself doesn’t fit that part. It’s so like yay! you beat this boss! Feel great about yourself! And all that jazz. I feel like it’s too early in the game.

The Power Up song after you defeat the Garg just fits so much better, because it’s like “oh you defeated this guy? We’ll just to let you know, your still in this shithole and things aren’t even as bad as they can get yet”

I agree. Is not that the song itself is bad, it fits (makes sense) but at the same time it does not fit because it gives the player the wrong emotions about the scene (my opinion).

item.title: Blast Pit improvement suggestion...
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
I actually loved it when the piano kicked just before my ascent to the control room, then the guitar came in a few moments later. Then back to piano. The musical moment as a whole really is great.

The piano really nails the mood of Blast Pit. And the intense guitar makes you feel like “yeahh you’re about to get this!” It’s really wonderful stuff.
